intro: Bupleurum chaishoui, commonly known as Chinese skullcap, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its roots are valued in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is also used as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ecological value.
